title:
Performance study for anisotropic flow measurements in the MPD (NICA)
  experiment with fixed target
authors: P. Parfenov, M. Mamaev, A. Taranenko
abstract:
Studying the properties of strongly-interacting matter at high relative
baryon densities is one of the key scientific goals of the MPD (Multi-Purpose
Detector) experiment at the NICA accelerator complex. The performance of
measuring the azimuthal collective flow of identified charged hadrons at the
MPD facility in fixed-target mode is studied in this work.
